article_text:
In the center of Zhytomyr, a Russian air strike ruined the building of school No.25.

"A missile or a bomb [strike] has just been launched. The information on casualties will be released later. In fact, half of school was ruined. Rescue operations are underway," Zhytomyr Mayor Serhiy Sukhomlyn said in his video address, Ukrinform reports.

City school No.25 is located in Mala Berdychivska Street, near the central part of the city and the buildings of the Regional State Administration and the City Council.

As reported, on the night of March 2, the Russian invaders fired three missiles at Zhytomyr, damaging a residential area, a gas pipeline, the city hospital No.2, the regional perinatal center, the Koroliov Zhytomyr Military Institute, and shops.

As reported, on February 24, Russian president Vladimir Putin declared war on Ukraine and launched a large-scale invasion.

Russian troops are killing civilians, shelling and destroying key infrastructure facilities, and missiles hit Ukrainians' homes.

Martial law was imposed in Ukraine and general mobilization was announced. The Armed Forces of Ukraine, with the support of the entire nation, courageously resist Russian aggression.

Ukraine filed a lawsuit against the Russian Federation at the UN International Court of Justice in The Hague. International Criminal Court Prosecutor Karim Khan commenced an investigation into the situation in Ukraine.

ol

On Friday morning, a local school was hit. Half of the building was destroyed, but there were no casualties.

In Zhytomyr, 25 schools were attacked from the air. This was announced on the morning of Friday, March 4, by the mayor of the city, Sergei Sukhomlin.

He noted that half of the school had been destroyed. Rescue work is underway.

Later, the State Emergency Service reported that there were no victims or injured.

“At 09:35, information was received that in Zhytomyr, as a result of shelling and ammunition entering the school building on Malaya Berdychivska Street, the building was destroyed without subsequent burning. There were no preliminary victims or injured. Five people were evacuated,” the rescuers said.

A video from the scene has also surfaced online.

The day before it was reported that Russian aviation attacked two schools in Chernihiv and private houses. According to preliminary information, nine dead and four injured.

Before that, the Russian Federation launched a missile attack on the residential area of ​​​​Chernigov.



News from Perild.com in Telegram. Subscribe to our channel

On the morning of Friday, March 4, Russian Kafirs carried out a rocket or bomb attack on school 25 in Zhytomyr. This was reported by Zhytomyr Mayor Sergei Sukhomlin in a video message on Facebook.

"Just now there was a missile / bombing (now all the same) on the 25th school. On the victims and victims - a little later. In fact, half of the school is destroyed, rescue efforts are underway. I will give further information," said the mayor of the city.

Later, the mayor said that an air-raid alert was declared in the city. Earlier this week, an enemy strike on Zhytomyr destroyed an apartment building, with all the windows and doors in the hospital completely broken out.

The head of the Chernihiv regional state administration warned of the danger of new occupant air strikes on Chernihiv

Russian occupants will carry out air strikes on Chernihiv today. This opinion was expressed by Vyacheslav Chaus, head of the Chernihiv Regional State Administration, in a video message.

"The process on the city (Chernihiv), on law and order is controlled. What we have is not good. I am sure that the enemy will continue to carry out air strikes on the city of Chernihiv today. This is not good, because the enemy hits civilian infrastructure. Not a single military facility was damaged. "Yesterday we lost several schools, we lost several houses, these are the lives of our people, we lost our people," Chaus said.

Recall, on March 3, the Russian occupants launched a rocket attack on residential buildings in the center of Chernihiv.

The governor of the Nikolaev region reports on the attack on the city. He tells of civilian casualties.

https://t.me/mykolaivskaODA/415

Russian airstrikes have hit a school in the Ukrainian city of Zhytomyr, partially destroying the building, according to the mayor and multiple witnesses.

Video and photographs from the site showed smoke rising from piles of rubble and scattered lumps of concrete.

Serhiy Sukhomlyn, Zhytomyr’s mayor, said in a video address that the school had been hit by a “missile or a bomb” and that “half of school was ruined”.

As Russia continues to bomb buildings across Ukraine, citizens take a stand against the invading forces and President Volodymyr Zelenskyy receives a standing ovation following a speech to the European Parliament.

On Friday morning, Russian troops destroyed a school in Zhytomyr with an air strike.

City mayor Serhii Sukhomlyn reports that emergency services are working on site.

Casualties have not been reported yet.

As Russian aggression on Ukraine continues, the artillery shelling and airstrikes targeting civilians and infrastructure in dozens of Ukrainian cities are becoming more intense. The Organisation for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE) plans to send an expert mission to Ukraine to investigate reports of possible Russian war crimes and crimes against humanity.
